verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast searched <S%H2713><s%> me, and known <S%H3045><s%> me.
Thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> my downsitting <S%H3427><s%> and mine uprising <S%H6965><s%>, thou understandest <S%H995><s%> my thought <S%H7454><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>.
Thou compassest <S%H2219><s%> my path <S%H734><s%> and my lying down <S%H7252><s%>, and art acquainted <S%H5532><s%> with all my ways <S%H1870><s%>.
For there is not a word <S%H4405><s%> in my tongue <S%H3956><s%>, but, lo, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> it altogether.
Thou hast beset <S%H6696><s%> me behind <S%H268><s%> and before <S%H6924><s%>, and laid <S%H7896><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> upon me.
Such knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is too wonderful <S%H6383><s%> <S%H6383><s%> for me; it is high <S%H7682><s%>, I cannot <S%H3201><s%> attain unto it.
Whither shall I go <S%H3212><s%> from thy spirit <S%H7307><s%>? or whither shall I flee <S%H1272><s%> from thy presence <S%H6440><s%>?
If I ascend up <S%H5266><s%> into heaven <S%H8064><s%>, thou art there: if I make my bed <S%H3331><s%> in hell <S%H7585><s%>, behold, thou art there.
If I take <S%H5375><s%> the wings <S%H3671><s%> of the morning <S%H7837><s%>, and dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the uttermost parts <S%H319><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>;
Even there shall thy hand <S%H3027><s%> lead <S%H5148><s%> me, and thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> shall hold <S%H270><s%> me.
If I say <S%H559><s%>, Surely the darkness <S%H2822><s%> shall cover <S%H7779><s%> me; even the night <S%H3915><s%> shall be light <S%H216><s%> about me <S%H1157><s%>.

Yea, the darkness <S%H2822><s%> hideth <S%H2821><s%> not from thee; but the night <S%H3915><s%> shineth <S%H215><s%> as the day <S%H3117><s%>: the darkness <S%H2825><s%> and the light <S%H219><s%> are both alike to thee.
For thou hast possessed <S%H7069><s%> my reins <S%H3629><s%>: thou hast covered <S%H5526><s%> me in my mother's <S%H517><s%> womb <S%H990><s%>.

I will praise <S%H3034><s%> thee; for I am fearfully <S%H3372><s%> and wonderfully made <S%H6395><s%>: marvellous <S%H6381><s%> are thy works <S%H4639><s%>; and that my soul <S%H5315><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> right well <S%H3966><s%>.

My substance <S%H6108><s%> was not hid <S%H3582><s%> from thee, when I was made <S%H6213><s%> in secret <S%H5643><s%>, and curiously wrought <S%H7551><s%> in the lowest parts <S%H8482><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> did see <S%H7200><s%> my substance, yet being unperfect <S%H1564><s%>; and in thy book <S%H5612><s%> all my members were written <S%H3789><s%>, which in continuance <S%H3117><s%> were fashioned <S%H3335><s%>, when as yet there was none <S%H259><s%> of them.
How precious <S%H3365><s%> also are thy thoughts <S%H7454><s%> unto me, O God <S%H410><s%>! how great <S%H6105><s%> is the sum <S%H7218><s%> of them!
If I should count <S%H5608><s%> them, they are more in number <S%H7235><s%> than the sand <S%H2344><s%>: when I awake <S%H6974><s%>, I am still <S%H5750><s%> with thee.
Surely thou wilt slay <S%H6991><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, O God <S%H433><s%>: depart <S%H5493><s%> from me therefore, ye bloody <S%H1818><s%> men <S%H582><s%>.
For they speak <S%H559><s%> against thee wickedly <S%H4209><s%>, and thine enemies <S%H6145><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> thy name in vain <S%H7723><s%>.
Do not I hate <S%H8130><s%> them, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee? and am not I grieved <S%H6962><s%> with those that rise up <S%H8618><s%> against thee?
I hate <S%H8130><s%> them with perfect <S%H8503><s%> hatred <S%H8135><s%>: I count them mine enemies <S%H341><s%>.
Search <S%H2713><s%> me, O God <S%H410><s%>, and know <S%H3045><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%>: try <S%H974><s%> me, and know <S%H3045><s%> my thoughts <S%H8312><s%>:
And see <S%H7200><s%> if there be any wicked <S%H6090><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> in me, and lead <S%H5148><s%> me in the way <S%H1870><s%> everlasting <S%H5769><s%>.
